Title: Remington The Science and Practice Of Pharmacy -2 Vol. Set
Author: লিন্ডা এ. পিএইচ.ডি. ফেল্টন
Summary:
Remington: The Science and Practice of Pharmacy is a comprehensive and exhaustive reference for undergraduate students of Pharmacy. The book comprises chapters on pharmaceutical chemistry, pharmaceutical analysis and quality control, pharmaceutics, fundamentals of pharmacy practice, and patient care. In addition, the book consists of several diagrams and illustrations to understand the concepts better. This book is essential for pharmacists and drug formulators.

About Pharmaceutical Press
Pharmaceutical Press is the publishing division of the Royal Pharmaceutical Society. It produces a wide range of products including reference works, textbooks, professional titles, journals and digital products and services. Some of the books produced by Pharmaceutical Press includes Martindale: The Complete Drug Reference, Stockley's Drug Interactions and The Handbook of Pharmaceutical Excipients.
Book_Title: Remington The Science and Practice Of Pharmacy -2 Vol. Set

Title: Hospital Pharmacy
Author: মার্টিন স্টিফেনস
Summary: The pharmacy department is now an established part of most hospitals with the pharmacist playing a pivotal role in the pharmaceutical care of the patient. Hospital Pharmacy recognises the changes in the practice of pharmacy within the hospital setting and provides a detailed discussion of the vast range of services that are now provided. Each chapter is devoted to an area of pharmacy practice and considers its history and current practice before concluding with future developments. As well as considering well-established facets of hospital pharmacy practice, such as technical services and clinical pharmacy, this text also considers the evolving relationship of the hospital pharmacy with other healthcare departments. This new introductory text to the practice of pharmacy in secondary and tertiary care is essential reading for all healthcare professionals including pharmacy undergraduate students and pre-registration graduates.
